repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Southern Kordofan Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Southern Kordofan Agricultural
            Development Project in Sudan. The main objectives were as
            follows: (a) improved agricultural services by strengthening
            selected agricultural institutions in the project area; (b)
            increased availability of farm inputs; (c) improved water
            supply and road infrastructure; and (d) improved crop
            production technology.  Bank's performance was not
            satisfactory. Borrower's performance was not
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            attempts to implement a project under insecure conditions
            are likely to result in a squandering of resources for
            meagre results; (ii) an integrated approach to development
            should not mean that all directions should be pursued
            simultaneously; (iii) the broad strategy needed to structure
            project activities should be defined before implementation
            and be shared by the major actors; (iv) a project should be
            implemented through existing line agencies; and (v) full
            cost recovery for water yards appears too heavy for the
            resources of most farmers in the project area.

repnme.cdata!:
Sudan - Southern Kordofan Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the South Kordofan
            Agricultural Project is to provide a sound institutional
            framework and, through selected direct interventions, to
            assist smallholder farmers and livestock owners in Southern
            Kordofan to improve their standard of living.  To achieve
            this, the project comprises (i) improved agricultural
            services by strengthening selected agricultural institutions
            in the project area; (ii) increased availability of farm
            inputs; (iii) improved water supply and road infrastructure;
            and (iv) improved crop production technology.  Cost recovery
            systems would be established for appropriate services and
            inputs, and measures would be taken to enhance environmental protection.

Sudan - Southern Kordofan Agricultural
